name: Winter Lentil Vegetable Soup
author: Cecile Leverman
summary: This soup has very little fat, is cheap and easy to make and delicious. Our family practically lives on it in the winter and I usually double the recipe.  Sprinkle grated cheddar on top if you wish. If you can't hang around long enough for this to cook, put it in a slow cooker.
ingredients: ½ cup red or green lentils
1 (28 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, chopped
directions: Place the lentils into a stockpot or a Dutch oven and add water to twice the depth of the lentils
Bring to a boil, then lower heat and let simmer for about 15 minutes
Drain and rinse lentils; return them to the pot
Add onion, celery, cabbage, tomatoes, chicken broth, carrots and garlic to the pot and season with salt, pepper, sugar, basil, thyme and curry
Cook, simmering for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until desired tenderness is achieved
